001package pkg_class;
002import pkg_class.pkg_command.CommandWords;
003
004import java.util.StringTokenizer;
005
006/**
007 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
008 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.   
009 * 
010 * This parser reads user input and tries to interpret it as an "Adventure"
011 * command. Every time it is called it reads a line from the terminal and
012 * tries to interpret the line as a three word command. It returns the command
013 * as an object of class Command.
014 *  
015 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
016 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
017 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
018 * 
019 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau + Elie Duboux
020 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2013.09.15 + 20201.12.12
021 * @see Command
022 * @see CommandWords
023 */
024public class Parser 
025{
026    /**
027     * Holds all valid command words.
028     */
029    private CommandWords aValidCommands;    
030    /**
031     * Create a parser to read from the terminal window.
032     */
033    public Parser() 
034    {
035        this.aValidCommands = new CommandWords();
036    } // Parser()
037
038    /**
039     * @return The next command from the user.
040     * @param pInputLine The string typed by the user.
041     */
042    public Command getCommand(final String pInputLine) 
043    {
044        String vWord1 = null;
045        String vWord2 = null;
046        String vWord3 = null;
047
048        // find up to two words on the line.
049        StringTokenizer vTokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
050        
051        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
052            vWord1 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
053        else
054            vWord1 = null;
055
056        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
057            vWord2 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get second word
058        else
059            vWord2 = null;
060
061        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
062            vWord3 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get third word
063        else
064            vWord3 = null;
065        
066        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
067        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
068        
069        Command vCommand = this.aValidCommands.get(vWord1);
070        if ( vCommand!= null) 
071        {
072            vCommand.setSecondWord(vWord2);
073            vCommand.setThirdWord(vWord3);
074        }
075        
076        return vCommand;
077    }//getCommand()
078    
079    /**
080     * Get a list of valid command words.
081     * @return The String of the valid commands.
082     */
083    public String getCommandList()
084    {
085        return this.aValidCommands.getCommandList();
086    }//getCommandList()
087} // Parser
